result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua Luke Shult was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Joshua Luke Shult
parties.address: 70 W River Ave Apt #4, Barron, WI 54812

parties.name: Rusk County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Will combine with current payment plan.

The Court orders that if the defendant fails to pay the fine and costs within 60 days of the date of conviction or if the Court has authorized monthly payments for the fine and costs and they have not been paid, the Court will enter a judgment and all available enforcement actions may be used to collect this debt.  You must keep the Clerk of Circuit Court informed of your current address until the debt is paid in full.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: DE is now employed at Rockwell Automation, starting date of August 28, 2014.  DE is currently working second shift.  Personal notification of employment by DE
dated 8/21/14 from LP to DE with attached billing of attorney fees.
Claim for services with attached itemized billing from Attorney Terry Nussberger

Defendant Joshua Luke Shult in court with attorney Terry L. Nussberger.  Rachel Payne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 14CF48.  14CF48-waive reading of information, enter a plea of NG.  Parties have come to an agreement, will proceed to sentencing today.  Court instructs on plea questionnarie/waiver of rights.  Court is satisfied will accept waiver.  DE will enter a plea of G to the amended charge of misd. bail jumping.  Court will accept and find the DE guilty.  Will order a fine of $200.00 and CC.  DAGP in 13CF130 will be extended for one year, until 12-12-16.  Will pay the DNA surcharge, will combine with current payment plan.  Court informs of appellate rights.

records.descr: Notice of intent to pursue post-conviction relief

records.addlTxt: Defendant Joshua Luke Shult in court with attorney Terry L. Nussberger.  Andrea Amidon Nodolf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DE will waive prelim hearing, court instructs on waiver of prelim.  Court finds probable cause, will bind over for JT.  Track with 13CF130.  Information filed this day by the State.
Will repay at the rate of $25.00 per month commencing 10-01-14
records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: The defendant shall repay the attorney fees at $25.00 per month commencing October 1, 2014, until paid in full.  All payments are made to the Rusk County Clerk of Circuit Court.
Preliminary hearing on July 29, 2014 at 03:30 pm.
Cannot be anywhere alcohol is present, any stores, gas stations etc.  Will do twice daily PBT's at the direction of the SD.

Defendant Joshua Luke Shult in court.  Andrea Amidon Nodolf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DE does not qualify for PD services, has made application for court appointed counsel.  The court puts DE under oath, questions on application for counsel.  The court will appoint counsel, will repay at the rate of $25.00 per month, commencing 10-01-14.  Will proceed with INIT APP today, per the request of the DE.  Court reads CC to DE.  State is not opposed to a sign bond if DE is released he must complete once daily PBT's.  $5000.00 sign bond, cannot be anywhere alcohol is present, any stores, gas stations etc.  Will do twice daily PBT's at the direction of the SD.  Will set for prelim hearing 7-29-14 @ 3:30PM.
NOT TO POSSESS OR CONSUME ALCOHOL. NOT TO BE ANYWHERE ALCOHOL IS PRESENT.
